name: Nitricum acidum
Relationship: Complementary: ARS.; CALAD.; LAC CAN.; SEPIA.Compare: MERC.; KALI-C.; THUJA; HEPAR; CALC.Inimical: LACH.

Mind: Sensitive to noise, pain, touch, jar
Stomach: Longing for indigestible things - chalk, earth, etc. pain in cardiac orifice
Dyspepsia with excess of oxalic acid, uric acid and phosphates in urine and great mental depression
Abdomen: Bowels constipated, with fissures in rectum
Violent cutting pains after stools, lasting for hours
Mouth: Tongue clean, red and wet with center furrow
Teeth become loose; gums soft and spongy
Painful pimples on the sides of the tongue
Ulcers in soft palate, with sharp, splinter-like pains
Respiratory: Soreness at lower end of sternum
Aphonia, with dry hacking cough, from tickling in larynx and pit of stomach
Head: Hair falls out
Scalp sensitive
Headaches from pressure of hat; full feeling; worse from street noises
Sensation of a band around head
Nose: Stitches, as of a splinter in nose
Nasal diphtheria, with watery and exceedingly excoriating discharge
Coryza, with sore and bleeding nostrils
Chronic nasal catarrh, with yellow, offensive, corrosive discharge
Green casts from nose every morning
Male: Ulcers; burn and sting; exude, offensive matter
Soreness and burning in glans and beneath prepuce
Ears: Difficult hearing; better by riding in carriage or train
Very sensitive to noise, as the rattle of wagons over pavements
Urine: Alternation of cloudy, phosphatic urine with profuse urinary secretion in old prostatic cases
Female: Leucorrhoea brown, flesh-colored, watery, or stringy, offensive
Menses early, profuse, like muddy water, with pain in back, hips and thighs
Skin: Black pores on face, papules worse on forehead
Warts, large jagged; bleed on washing
Ulcers bleed easily, sensitive; splinter-like pains; zigzag, irregular edges; base looks like raw flesh
Throat: White patches and sharp points, as from splinters, on swallowing
Extremities: Sweating of palms, hands; cold, blue nails
Fetid foot-sweat, causing soreness of toes, with sticking pain; chilblains on toes
Offensive sweat in axillae at night

details: Selects for its special seat of action the outlets of the body where the mucous membrane and skin meet; these pain AS FROM SPLINTERS. STICKING PAINS. Marked improvement of all symptoms while riding in a carriage. Acts best on the dark complexioned and past middle life. Syphilis, after abuse of Mercury. Pains appear and disappear quickly. (BELL.) Hydrogenoid constitution. Sycotic remedy.Blisters and ulcers in mouth, tongue, genitals; bleed easily. Fissures, with pain during stool, as if rectum were torn. All discharges very offensive, especially urine, faeces, and perspiration. Persons who have chronic diseases, and take cold easily and disposed to diarrhoea. Excessive physical irritability. Cachexia, due to syphilis, scrofula, intermittent fever with liver involvement and anemia, etc. Gravel; arthritis. Capillary bleeding after curettage.
dosage: Sixth potency. As the nitric acid patient begins to improve skin symptoms may appear for a time, a favorable indication.
